oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gumpert, G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Our Country's Flag
Beneath the stars and stripes there stand our sons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An illustration of a young man in uniform holding a flag on a staff in front of a line of white tents. Printed below the image are the words "Song Composed & Dedicated to His Excellency Abraham Lincoln, President of the United States, by G. Gumpert."

This colorful sheet music cover was published during the first year of the Civil War. Popular music, often played in civic settings, served to build morale as the country mustered for war. It is interesting to note that this song includes lyrics in German, reminding us that many young immigrants and first generation Americans either enlisted or were drafted into the armies on both sides. The young Union soldier holding the flag wears a uniform consisting of a blouse shirt and pants (no jacket) and neither he nor the camp behind him show any signs of the war weariness that set in once the early battles of the Civil War revealed the Confederate army to be a much more serious fighting force than the U.S. Army had anticipated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Flags; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Songs and music; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Music and the war; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Music and the war.
Capturing the Flag
